reviews.review_msg: I would say this is a good quality and at the meantime challenging course for a undergraduate student. I made every effort and devote more than 8 hours a week to read assigned papers and prepare for in lecture presentation. With all these being done, I got a relatively good result as I expected.
The course content is very useful and the lecture is great. You will need to make lots of effort to keep your pace with the instructor. Digging deep into the material is necessary and rewarding.

He grades randomly. Don't bother taking this course. You might not attend the classes and you would get 10 out of the 10 for class participation. You might upload an "empty" project for assignment 3 and you would get 3,4 points. There are no set rules for the grading.

Prof has outstanding fundamental knowledge in Computing sciences. Tough assignments. covers 2hrs of topics in an hour. Grad seminar course, so students talk more than prof and students cant emulate prof. mostly self learning in the course and project. I feel they should rethink about course structure and limit student seminars to final presentation
